Replies.Reply: We did not always live in hiding.

But the Naturals made war on us. They feared us for our strength. They envied our powers. They called us monsters, killing us by whatever means their malice could invent, finding in each of us our particular vulnerability.   We are scanning scenes of that war. A breed being staked like a vampire. Another being shot like a werewolf. Another exposed to sunlight.
None of us was safe. The tribes of the moon dwindled. Our gods were slaughtered, our homes destroyed. It was the Apocalypse.
Only one of our Gods survived the holocaust. Baphomet.
His name is Cabal. He will lead and give us back the Night.
Nine-thirty. I was letting you doze.
We should get out of Calgary for a few days. Just take off.
Somewhere we can be alone together.
Yeah. Just you and me. No work. No telephone calls. No...
I know. I always know. It's no big deal.
Say it like you mean it.
If he can help, see him. Tell him it's all gone but the bad dreams.
No. You sound like the man I love. A little haunted, maybe, but the sanest man I ever met.
Where's the harm? You tell him from me, I'm the only thing you should be dreaming about.
I don't want to be competing with things I can't see, Boone.
I can't hear that often enough.
No. Let's get it over with.
A draft and some information please.
They think some sick bastard's stole the body.
You don't have to do that.
And he just happened to be checked in here at the crossroads of the world.
Sheryl, you sure you want to come along?
Is Boone here? Did somebody bring him here?
No! I just want some answers.
I kind of got that impression.
Wait! Wait a minute! Boone, Aaron Boone, just tell me, is he here? You took him, you took his body, didn't you? Hey!
Sheryl, we have to go, uh, something's kind of come up and...
How do you know my name?
Why? Why did you kill her?
Help me! Oh please, God, somebody.
But he's dead, I saw him in the morgue...
But he didn't kill anybody, it wasn't him, he's innocent...
Where is he? Where'd he go?
Take me there, I've got to find Boone...
No problem, you tell me where he is and we're outta here...
Where is he? He's down here isn't he? You want to stop me you're gonna have to kill me.
I have to. Nothing makes any sense without him.
They don't need you. Nobody needs you but me. We'll go away, far away, where no-one will ever find us. I love you.
I'll get my stuff, I'll be back in two minutes...
They must be at the rodeo.
I have to go, Babette, I have to get help. I'll be back, I promise. You hide somewhere.
Tell me about it; what's happened to him?
Okay. So what you're saying is, you're saying he's dead.
They're going to come for you.
You can't die. Midian needs you.
All right. If not for the Breed, then for me. You can't give up on us.
be, but I'm not. I still want you, whatever you are. And I'm not going to leave you. If they come for you, then they'll have to kill me too.
So fight. For both of us. For all of us. I don't want to be dust. I want us flesh and blood. Kiss me. I love you.
That doesn't make him yours. I belong here on this wall, just as much as you do. Why aren't I here?
That? My tribe? Not any longer.
Then make me belong too; they made you one of them, you can do it to me...
I want to be with you.
then, just go. Go on! What more do you want? Leave me some dignity, for Christ's sake!
I lied, I lied, you're all I want.
Well why don't you do something about it, God damn it...
You said you'd never leave me.
Thought you'd worn me out, huh?
I'm going around in some crazy loop in my head.
I believe it. I'm not crazy. But I want this damn dream out of my head.   He gets up and goes to the window.
I don't know. I haven't called him back.
They're not bad. That's what's weird. The more I have them the more I like them. Now I do sound like a crazy, right?
I don't think he'd get it. He never had a wet dream in his life.
I'm not going anywhere, Lori. Except with you.
I'll never leave you. Not ever. I swear.
Can't remember a time when I didn't love you.
That wasn't me. I heard about Midian from other people.
I suppose I did. It was a place of refuge.
You know what I used to dream.
What did you say, just now?
know...where it is. Don't you? We could go there...
That's right. But first I need to know...you have to tell me...where it is.
But you do know. Don't you?
Let's get some help in here!
His shout echos. The wind blows up a cloud of dust around him. He walks through the dust, on the verge of tears. And then...the dust clears, and he sees...
No! I've killed people, I'm like you, that's why I'm here...
I didn't...didn't come to die. I came to be with you, I'm one of you.
I'm not sure I want to be a member.
I'll kill him. No-one will ever know.
I won't listen to him butcher her. I love her.
Isn't this where the dead are supposed to go?
No? Isn't that you, Dr Decker, hiding behind that child's mask?
Not just dead...changed. A monster. Want me to show you?
Not your kind of monster. Not the soulless kind. I've got Midian in my veins.
Let her go!     Narcisse, all sheepish co-operation, gently lets her go onto the ground.
Decker can't tell anyone. What's he going to say? That he tried to kill a girl and a dead man stopped him?
So maybe I should speak to this guy.
I don't want you to see...
Get out! Do as I say!
You know what I did in that room? I'm a goddamn cannibal.
Let them. Let them find some way to kill me.
Midian's just a hole in the ground. It's full of things that should lie down and stay dead.
You talk like you're one of them.
It's about time they saw the truth.
Listen to me, old man, the rules change; if you want to live it won't be here and it won't be by your laws...
It must be done. Brothers and sisters, it's time to fight!
If we stay below they'll slaughter us.
No. The night's ours. Now get the rest of the children up here, I'm going to find a clear way through!
What the hell are you doing down here? We need help!
Fuck that! We're not going to lie down and die.
So did I. I learned better. We can make it out. But I need fighters.
All the better. Let them out. Don't just stand there!
Be quick. We haven't got forever. Yet.
You come with me. The rest of you get out of here.
Arm yourselves! Defend yourselves! You're not cattle, for Christ's sake. They don't have any right to kill you!
Weapons! You need weapons or it's over!
Stop them getting in! They'll kill the children!
The west wall! But be quick! I'm going after Eigerman.
Run, go on! We don't like priests here.
Decker's dead. Take the knife out.
When I need you where will I find you?
Okay, you want ham, cheese, pickle, mustard?
Sweetie, you're supposed to be beddy-bye.
No, everything's okay. You go back to bed, munchkin, I'll be up to see you in a minute.
All of the above and a brewski, thank you.
Yeah. Makes me feel a whole lot better about the sick fuck.
He's talking but he's not making any sense. Something about a place called Midian.
Miss Winston, are you sure you wouldn't rather postpone...
How long had you known Aaron Boone?
So he never gave any indication ...
Surely there must have been something ...
We'll continue this some other time.
Someone brought the corpse down here?
I saw him pumped full of bullets.
He was right about the motel.
So maybe there are more of them...
Killers. A cult. I don't know.
If that's the case we'll call for back-up...
God damn it! There's something wrong with him...
It was the sun. The sun did it.
Man, that tears it, I'm calling the fuckin' chief.
Who did it, did you see anyone?   Tommy shakes his head. They all look up, hearing a distant car engine.
Has it occurred to you maybe we've got this all wrong? We could be destroying...I don't know, a whole new species.
Eigerman's invited you to watch from the command post.
...I've got a bad feeling about this.
I don't know. The only monsters I've ever seen had a human face.
If it's any comfort, they went quickly.
Find this guy, Joyce. They say these guys want to be caught.
Deceased is a white Caucasian male, late twenties. Suspected cause of death, multiple gunshot wounds to the thoracic cavity and extremities.
Wound number one: entered between the fourth and fifth left ribs, impacted the lower rib, lodging in ligaments adjacent to the left lung ...
I've been listening to the tapes of our sessions. All two years' worth...
Most of my colleagues would have walked away from a case like yours. The most they would have done was drug you. But you...you intrigued me. All the talk of monsters. And Midian. Remember Midian?
But you made it part of your private mythology.
When you imagined yourself being taken off to this invented city, to Midian, what crimes were you going to be forgiven?
Yes. There's a remarkable consistency in the images you see.
But murder does, Boone. Murder's very real. It may start in the mind, but it ends up changing to flesh and blood.
What you describe in your sessions is very specific. Houses; faces...
Six families killed over a two year period. All within driving distance of Calgary...
I hope to God you didn't, for both our sakes. We've come a long way together. I don't want to believe this any more than you do.
I wouldn't put us through this pain if I didn't...if I wasn't...afraid you had.
I can only go so far on your behalf. Patient confidentiality's one thing. Protecting a killer is another.

Listen to me. Take these, they'll help. Go home, and consider what we've talked about. I'm going to give you twenty-four hours to go to the police and answer their questions of your own accord. That's as long as I can give you. if you haven't complied by then, I'm afraid I'll have to tell them what I know.
I'll do my best. But I'll need privacy.
Boone, listen to him, it's no use!
It's safe, I've seen to that.
Lori, I'm Dr Decker. Boone was my patient.
I'm so sorry for your loss. I must tell you, you meant the world to Aaron. He spoke of you constantly ...
Miss Winston, everyone has their secret faces ...
Miss Winston, I hope you didn't misinterpret what I said.
Let's get it over with, shall we?
Good question. No reason why you shouldn't have an answer.
Why did I kill all the others? For the fun of it, of course.
Is innocent, wherever he's hiding. After all the trouble I went to to find him a home for his guilt.
Boone's alive, Lori. And your death is going to bring him out of hiding.
That's good. Be still. It's quicker that way.
it was the mask and they were going to find me, punish me, I needed a scapegoat...
So did I. But he's alive. He killed again...
Midian's not empty. There's something breeding there. Below the cemetery.
Yes I do. And if you don't stop them there's going to be more bloodshed. I promise.
I'm going back to Midian with you.
Don't trust him. He...he...changes. I've seen him.
As I told you, these aren't ordinary people. You're saying he should be dead?
We can't let anyone see us...
Oh, I don't think I'm up to it, really.
Believe me, Lieutenant, whoever or whatever's living down there deserves what's coming.
Quite a dance, huh? Death everywhere and you and me in the middle. Catch!
don't know what kind of fuel he's using, but this guy's cruising at about 35,000 feet.
we're doing all right, aren't we? Tell me, what've you been taking tonight, partner?
She nods. With considerable effort, Boone sits up urgently and grabs the doctor's hand, holding the pills.
Shit! I've missed them, I've missed them! You scared them off, you kept them from me!
I said shut up, you want to ruin everything?
It's where the monsters go. It takes away the pain...
See, they only take you if you're worthy. You know what they do to those that aren't worthy?
They sent you. They sent you to take me.
a monster, that's how it works; I show you, then you take me with you...
You'll like this. No, really. It's just their way of welcoming you to the club.
You made your way back here for the same reasons I did. We belong here now. There's nowhere else on earth would take us in.
balls. And his eyes. That is, if you don't want them.
Remember me, Doctor? I was dying when you had your way with me. You made me tell my secrets when I was feeling particularly vulnerable. Now was that a nice thing for a doctor to do?
You think love can raise the dead?
He's that and more. If you don't believe me, you wait 'til he gets to sniff a little blood. That'll bring out the beast in him.
We have to get Boone out, Midian needs him...
And survived; nobody ever did that before.
He was bitten by a Nightbreed, see, the taint's in his system...
Hey, some of my best friends are dead.
What the hell are you doing in there?
Is this wise? Coming above ground?
Any hiding place they can find. It'll be dawn soon.
You'll find me. And you will need me.
He's dying. I think he wants to die.
We should take him below, Peloquin.
If we eat him we break the Law.
We mustn't. It's the Law. They'll exile us...
That way! The gate's that way!
He's gone, give it up! You don't dare go out there!
There were prophesies. The seventh saviour.
His name is Cabal. He unmade Midian.
more animal than human, but no recognizable species.
Shut the fuck up. You're meat.
And Midian's where the monsters live. And you came to die.
No. Sorry. I can smell innocence at fifty yards.
He lied, asshole. He lied. You're a Natural. And that means...you're meat for the Beast.
Fuck the Law! I want meat!
I know you. He talks about you. Lori.
That's only because the bite was mine.
I just wanted meat. I didn't know he was going to cause this.
I didn't believe the prophesies and I didn't obey the Law.
It's all over. I didn't believe the prophesies and now it's all over.
All these years waiting for a saviour. But he hasn't saved us. He's destroyed us. I made him, and he's destroyed us.
The bite was mine. The bite that mocks death.
You're still a Natural. Go back while you've still got a life. Join your tribe.
Then die with us. It's over.
Jesus. They weren't takin' any chances.
Had a bunch of TV news folks passin' through, since they nailed that baby-slasher up there.
Yeah, hell of a week for us. The rodeo this weekend. That scumbag gets blown away. I hear it took thirty slugs to bag that sucker. Just goes to show you, don't it? People love a spectacle.
Right around the corner there, darlin'.
Courtesy of that gent in the suit at the end of the bar.
Sheryl, a girl in her early twenties, exits.
usually one or the other, ain't it?
Jesus, did he come back? That's even worse.
Hell, yes you can. Better than gettin' hit on by some damn buffalo.
So you want to go check out the place in which he checked out?
Tell you what, Lori, why don't I drive up there to this Medium place with you tomorrow and keep you company?
Yeah, but I'm goin' to and I don't want no argument from you.
You get some rest, sugar. I'm gonna stay down here and close this damn bar. Maybe one of these lunkheads'll win the lottery.
Isn't that something? His name is Curtis, he is a banker, recently divorced and recently relocated in Edmonton, up for the rodeo and better yet, he thinks I am the Queen-bee's knees.
Wouldn't miss it. Besides, Curtis has to do business today, we've got an engagement for this evening and if I sit around all day with this head on I'm gonna feel like the hind end of a dog sled.
Now if we could just make a quick stop for some Alka-Seltzer.
Jesus. Looks like the gold rush is over.
Sheryl Ann. You go do what you have to do. I'll stay here and...do somethin' else.
Curtis ... what are you doing here?
No, don't you see? He's the one from the prophesies.
Everything has its purpose. Maybe he hasn't learned to hate his tribe enough. He'll be back.
Have you tutored him in the Law?
You understand what you do, becoming one of us? With this night you turn your back on the Natural World. The life you lived will after this be as a dream.
The blood of the God tells all truths. It can harm as easily as heal. Are you prepared to be judged?
Aaron Boone, in the name of Baphomet, Lord of the tribes of the moon, I bid you welcome...
Rachel...you have said too much already.
We know. But you cannot help her.
You weren't meant to see this.
Then you also understand that to speak of this to anyone will bring dire consequences . . .
When we took you in you made an oath to obey the Law.
She's a Natural. She couldn't love you back. Not now.
You've put us all in danger for your love of this woman.
Just take the girl and go on your way amongst the Naturals. That's the Law.
Baphomet. The God in Obsidian. Who made Midian.
Baphomet is a spirit in stone. He doesn't speak, or move.
What Baphomet made he has the power to unmake. His blood is volatile. He mustn't be angered.
You're not to blame, but you must understand: what Boone's done has put us in jeopardy...
Boone has gone to Baphomet. He is beyond recall.
Stay down! Stay where you are, they're waiting for us above...
It's Baphomet's will. He's going to destroy the Naturals, and us. Everything, in one last fire.
Better it ends quickly. We can't escape them. We remind them of the darkness in themselves. They hate that.
No...she can't die. Bring her to me, please.
Pay no attention. Please, bring me my Babette.
She likes to play outside. I tell her: you mustn't play in the sun. The sun will hurt you. But she's just a child. She doesn't understand.
You must go, this place is not for you. Midian is a home for the Nightbreed. Only for the Nightbreed.
My Lylesburg, she brought me Babette, she saved her . . .
She even knew you were coming here. She saw it all, through your eyes.
You still don't understand, do you?
We're shapeshifters; freaks; remains of races your species have almost driven to extinction.
Far from it. The sun can kill some of us. Like Babette. She follows her father in that. Some of us could be shot down; others would survive that because they've got beyond death.

To be able to fly? To be smoke, or a wolf; to know the night, and live in it forever? That's not so bad. You call us monsters, but when you dream, it's of flying and changing, and living without death. You envy us. And what you envy...
He is Nightbreed. Or he was, until he broke the Law.
Down to the Tabernacle, to Baphomet.
The Baptiser. Who made Midian. Who called us here and saved us from our enemies...
He went into Baphomet's chamber. He spoke with the Baptiser...
Perhaps Baphomet told him something, something that could save Midian.
He has powers of his own.
Boone has been turned, he's one of us...
Come closer...I don't want to kill you...
On the next wind. If not tonight, then tomorrow.
Be still. It was a bad hurt he did us.
I felt your hurt. I still feel it.
And you can see through mine.
Let me down. I can't go any further.
Thou shalt not suffer a monster to live...

racks, crucifixion, floggings, a hanging. The camera moves off gallows, past a wall to flags. We cut close on the flag which reads FREAK SHOW, track past the flag to a cage, containing freakish Breed.
What are you doing in my office?
We don't need any city boys on the case. Midian's under my jurisdiction.
No we don't. I'll bring him in myself. This is my town.
Yeah. I heard that talk. That's nuthouse talk.
They haul Boone to his feet. Eigerman hits Boone with a wicked blackjack.
I'm not going anywhere. We got press folks and photographers coming in from all over. Wouldn't be polite to keep 'em waiting.
Tell him. We got our man under lock and key.
You want to take some of the boys, take 'em Pettine?
You, Tommy and Gibbs, take the Inspector out to the cemetery. Dig around. If you find anything with more two eyes, holler. I got photographers wanting me...
Yes he may have had accomplices but I can't reveal the precise source of my information on that...
We found him with a piece of human flesh in his mouth.
Just exactly how many bullets did they put into this geek up at Midian?
Not lying down dead, friend. Walkin' around in my fucking cell dead. Now what about that?
Listen up! We got officers under attack, I need volunteers for a posse! Y'all sign up with Officer Labowitz here!
If you're gonna make an omelette you have to break eggs, isn't that right, Professor?

Ounce a' prevention is worth a pound a' cure. Save for a rainy day, one day that day will come. Don't matter if it's Commies, homos, freaks or Japs, we are ready. World class ordnance, Doc: the best private sector money can buy.
Now I know what you're thinkin', Doc; maybe there's some sort'a spiritual angle to all this. Well, we got that covered, too.
Reverend Ashberry, your services are required.
some Holy Water and crucifixes...we're goin' in there with God on our side.
You are all hereby deputized in the name of the law. Now let's kick some ass!
on a crusade against the Devil himself.
Get the hell up that hill, you pinhead.
That's right; hang round here a couple more minutes, Padre, and you'll be sitting at his left hand. Now get your sorry ass out of the fuckin' way...
That sound like a heavenly choir to you, Padre?
They're coming out, and they're armed, so watch yourselves. It's a fucking freak-show in there! We're not taking prisoners! It's us or them! Let's clean up!
the balls to pull the trigger.
Eigerman turns, looks and fires as Boone leaps at him. He roars, effortlessly picks Eigerman up and body-slams him against the wall of Midian.
Stand your ground! Stand your ground! They've got to come this way. We can mow 'em down.
What the hell are you talking about?
You mean you can find them?
We'll go together then. You can lead me to the bastards.
You can't, you don't have the wits ...
This is Inspector Joyce. Calgary Police Department.
Now over here we're talkin' Damascus, high-carbon Spetnatz shootin' knives, and for that tough up-close-and-
...packets of plastique at every intersection, trip wires outside the biggest tombs, we figure those'll be the major escape routes...
planted in the rosebushes, Reverend, cut your nuts off faster'n a hedge clipper.
Us or them! Us or them!
Look at these bastards. Fucking freaks.
Hey, Ghost! Hey, Slaughter! Come and get me! Come and get me!
monsters and demons doing battle with angels. He puts the book down, and turns over his palm. It is a mass of tiny scars.
Christ, you could hide a fuckin' army in here.
There's people down there, I can feel it.
There's something down there all right.
Want we should interrogate it, Lieutenant?
Two hours. Two and a half. I told 'em to bring gasoline.
You saw that fucker below, Lieutenant, same as me. That damn thing was just too weird to live.
Look what we got here! A freak-show nursery school.
Pettine's on the radio, they're under attack.
No, I'm saying he is dead.

Can you hear me? They'll find a way to kill you, you know that? Can't fight the darkness. Not when it's inside you. Are you listening? You're an abomination, Boone. You have to die. There's lots of ways. I've read about them. Seen them when I sleep. Horrible. HEAR ME?
Have you got a God, Boone? Any God'll do. I had one, but...he doesn't listen any more. I ask him to take the dreams away but they keep coming. Blood and fire. Like the end of the world...
We've made a mistake, there are Angels here, a heavenly host...
No. Listen to me, it's wrong, it's sacrilege, this is holy ground...
You brought me here because I'm a man of God.
No, no, take me, I have to see.
I saw their God...I saw him...
I can still smell him. He's out there...
No. They're mine. Their God burned me. I want to burn him back. All of them. Burn them all away.
What egg-zactly are we lookin' for, Sarge?
Well what if they engage us? What about that?
Well, lookee what we got here...
Shit. Don't look so tough to me.
Shit! Shit! Get it off me! Tommy!
Couldn't have been just...just the sun...
at the button head mask inside. He snaps the case shut as Eigerman re-enters, followed by the silent Kane. Eigerman digs a key out of his desk.
Little Irish in your joe, Constable Labowitz?
They call us monsters, remember? They're afraid of us. Let's give 'em reason.
I wouldn't do that if I were you.
What chance have we got? They're armed.
It's a long time since I spilled blood.
He can't help us. He's too late.
Breed being beaten or burned to death, impaled on stakes. Boone assists some along the way, pulling off their assailants.
I'm not Boone, Lori. Do you understand? I belong to the Breed now.
I'll come back for you when I'm finished...
Don't die, God, Lori, don't die...
